Job Position: Digital Marketer

Overview

	Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies across multiple channels.

	Are you a visionary economist passionate about driving sustainable development through data-driven insights and strategic policy influence?
	Our client is seeking an exceptional Chief Economist to lead economic research, guide policy formulation, and provide strategic direction that strengthens the institution&rsquo;s impact and aligns with national development goals.


About the Role


	The Chief Economist will serve as a trusted advisor to the CEO and executive leadership, providing critical economic intelligence that informs strategy, funding decisions, and policy engagement.
	You&rsquo;ll lead research on macroeconomic trends, agricultural finance, and financial inclusion &mdash; ensuring that the institution remains economically resilient and strategically positioned to drive inclusive growth.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Master&rsquo;s Degree in Economics, Development Economics, Agricultural Economics, or a related field (PhD is an advantage).
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in economic research, policy analysis, or consulting &mdash; ideally in the agricultural finance or development sectors.
	Strong background in macroeconomics, econometrics, and policy formulation.
	Demonstrated ability to provide actionable insights that drive institutional or national economic strategy.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Advanced econometric and financial modeling skills (Excel proficiency required).
	Expertise in agricultural economics, development finance, and financial inclusion policies.
	Strong communication and presentation abilities &mdash; especially with policy and regulatory audiences.
	Analytical mindset with high integrity, strategic thinking, and discretion.
	Proven ability to engage effectively with external partners, including government agencies and international financial institutions.


Method of Application

Chief Economist (Development Finance / Agriculture Sector) Job at Workforce Group




        
    

        
        Workforce Group - Our client, a leading institution in agricultural finance and rural development, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Economist (Development Finance / Agriculture Sector)

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Managing Director / CEO

Job Description

	Are you a visionary economist passionate about driving sustainable development through data-driven insights and strategic policy influence?
	Our client is seeking an exceptional Chief Economist to lead economic research, guide policy formulation, and provide strategic direction that strengthens the institution’s impact and aligns with national development goals.


About the Role


	The Chief Economist will serve as a trusted advisor to the CEO and executive leadership, providing critical economic intelligence that informs strategy, funding decisions, and policy engagement.
	You’ll lead research on macroeconomic trends, agricultural finance, and financial inclusion — ensuring that the institution remains economically resilient and strategically positioned to drive inclusive growth.


Qualifications & Experience


	Master’s Degree in Economics, Development Economics, Agricultural Economics, or a related field (PhD is an advantage).
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in economic research, policy analysis, or consulting — ideally in the agricultural finance or development sectors.
	Strong background in macroeconomics, econometrics, and policy formulation.
	Demonstrated ability to provide actionable insights that drive institutional or national economic strategy.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Advanced econometric and financial modeling skills (Excel proficiency required).
	Expertise in agricultural economics, development finance, and financial inclusion policies.
	Strong communication and presentation abilities — especially with policy and regulatory audiences.
	Analytical mindset with high integrity, strategic thinking, and discretion.
	Proven ability to engage effectively with external partners, including government agencies and international financial institutions.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: executivesearch@workforcegroup.com using “Chief Economist – Development Finance” as the subject of the email.

Metering Project Officer Job at ETC Workforce Services Limited




        
    

        
        ETC Workforce Services Limited is a leading workforce management, outsourcing and advisory organization, empowering businesses to focus on their core competencies while we handle the complexities of HR, staffing, and operational support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Metering Project Officer
Job Location: Corporate Headquarters, Lagos
Reporting To: Metering Project Office Lead

Role Purpose

	We are looking for a dynamic and detail-oriented Project Management Officer to join our Metering Project Management Team. This role provides first-level support for metering-related complaints and project coordination under various metering schemes including MAP and NMMP.


Key Responsibilities


	Respond to metering complaint escalations via email in line with established processes.
	Manage and track Service Requests (SRs) escalated on CRM, ensuring timely updates and resolution.
	Engage customers on metering issues, gather feedback, and collaborate with relevant units for process improvements.
	Document meeting minutes and distribute approved transcripts to participants.
	Maintain accurate records of SIM cards and their utilization under the MAP scheme.
	Coordinate requisition and delivery of work tools and resources for MAP projects, including meters and accessories.
	Track and document test meters submitted for Proof of Concept (POC).
	Log and monitor all project-related issues to ensure timely resolution.


Minimum Requirements


	First degree or equivalent diploma qualification.
	0–2 years of relevant work experience.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills.
